result.execSummary:
William L Robinson was found not guilty on all charges in this case. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William L Robinson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William L Robinson

Jury Trial exhibits from 08/15/2022- 08/16/2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 789.
Jury Instructions (Closings)

At the hour of  the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY which was then read.  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, William Robinson, NOT GUILTY of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, as charged in the Information."

Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 3:17 pm jury dismissed.

Court ordered entry of judgment of acquittal.

Defendant released from all conditions of bail.

Defendant William L Robinson in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
SAME DAY, SAME APPEARANCES.  COURT REPORTER CAROLE SEROTA-BODI

Motion to dismiss argued and DENIED by the Court.  Jury in the box at the hour of 1:22 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by State and Defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:09 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies John Knoll and  Rease Thoreson who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Jury Instructions (Openings)

Defendant William L Robinson in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Jury in the box at the hour of 9:18 am.
Sworn for the State:  Greendale Police Department Detective Jameson Durkin.  Direct examination.  Exhibit #2 marked, offered and received.  Cross Examination.  Redirect, recross.  Sworn for the State:  Greendale Police Department Detective Julie Barth.  Direct examination.  No cross.  Sworn for the State:  Trista P.  Direct examination.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 9:39 am.  Court takes short break.  Jury in the box at the hour of 9:57 am.  Direct examination continued.  Cross examination.  Re-Direct.  Sworn for the State:  Forensic Nurse Examiner Alison Lopez.  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  
State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 10:20 am.  Court takes short break.  Defense motion to dismiss at the close of State's case argued.  Court takes under advisement for dismissal as to venue.  
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.  Defense renews motion to dismiss.  Court asks the parties to provide case law.
Jury in the box at the hour of 11:21 am.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 11:23 am.  State argues motion to dismiss as to venue.  Court breaks for lunch.  Parties to return by 1:00 pm.

At the hour of 11:34 am Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:36 am.  Court breaks for lunch and orders jurors to return by 1:20 pm.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 12:11 pm.

Jury in the box at the hour of 1:39 pm.  Voir dire continued.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 2:29 pm.  Court takes short break.  Jury in the box at the hour of 3:08 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by State and Defense.  Trial proceeded.  
Sworn for the State:  Wisconsin State Crime Lab Analyst Debra Kaurala.  Direct examination.  Exhibit #1 marked, offered and received.  Cross examination, redirect and recross.  Sworn for the State:  Cassandra B.  Direct examination, cross and redirect.  Court breaks for the day and orders the Jury to return by 8:45 am on August 16, 2022.  Jury out of the box at the hour of 4:25 pm.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial August 16, 2022 at 9:00 am.

Defendant William L Robinson in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Jury Trial this date.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.

Defendant William L Robinson in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Jury Trial.  State and Defense are prepared to proceed with Trial.  Court adjourned due to family emergency.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William L Robinson in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  nk
Final Pretrial Held.  State and Defense remain in Trial posture.  State places Offer on the record; Defense does not reject Offer at this time.  Remains ready to proceed with Trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on May 23, 2022, at 8:30 am, Branch 12.

Defendant William L Robinson in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Final Pretrial held.  State prepared to proceed to trial.  Defense requests adjournment as he has discovery that he is reviewing and needs to turn it over to the State.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William L Robinson in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Final Pretrial held.  DNA Report received and forwarded to Defense this date.  Defense requests adjourned final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William L Robinson in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense received discovery and requests a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript  of  PRELIMINARY HEARING (22 pages) commencing 01-24-22 by  KATHERINE NELSON

Attorney Thomas J McClure in court, defendant William L Robinson not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo for Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Arraignment this date.  Defendant in custody, not prodeced due to Covid.  

  Arraignment scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Speedy trial demand.  Expires 4/27
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant William L Robinson in court by video with Attorney Thomas J McClure who appears in person.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Village of Greendale Detective J. Durkin. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed; defense given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  This hearing will be streamed live on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqYxLDHV-xN_RkKf_fE1jjw  Arraignment scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $35,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. Monitoring with for no contact order monitoring.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant William L Robinson in court with attorney Thomas J McClure.  Defendant William L Robinson in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
